text: Scholtzia eatoniana is a shrub species in the family Myrtaceae that is endemic to Western Australia. The diffuse to prostrate shrub typically grows to a height of . It blooms between November and December producing pink-white flowers. It is found in the Wheatbelt region of Western Australia between Tammin and Cunderdin. ==References== eatoniana Category:Plants described in 1931 Category:Taxa named by Charles Gardner
title: Scholtzia eatoniana
